name: Spleen
awareness: instinct / immune / survival timing (awareness in the now)
biological_themes: Spleen / lymph / immune surveillance (what is safe vs not safe)
Detox / filtration themes (what to keep, what to discharge)
Autonomic ‘startle’ and reflex timing (move now / stop now)
Ancient survival neurology tied to body smell, pattern, and proximity

fears.label: Fear of inadequacy
fears.description: Worry you don’t have enough depth, skill, or resources to survive or help.

fears.label: Fear of the future / what’s coming
fears.description: Hyper-alertness to subtle signals, afraid of danger that can’t be seen yet.

fears.label: Fear of the past repeating
fears.description: Instinctive alertness to old threats returning (old enemies, old patterns).

fears.label: Fear of failure / continuity loss
fears.description: Anxiety that what we built won’t last or be recognized by the tribe.

fears.label: Fear of death / meaninglessness
fears.description: The raw survival pulse that fights against oblivion.

fears.label: Fear of responsibility
fears.description: Concern about carrying and protecting others correctly.

fears.label: Fear of authority / imperfection
fears.description: Anxiety about challenging or correcting what’s unhealthy.

gates.name: 48 — The Well (Depth)
gates.circuitry: Collective (Logic) – Spleen → Root (58–18–48 axis of correction/depth)
gates.instinct_theme: Instinctive depth to solve problems for the collective.
gates.notes: 48 knows there is always more to learn. Correct use: offer depth when invited. Distortion: hoarding knowledge, never ‘ready’.

gates.name: 57 — The Gentle (Intuitive Clarity)
gates.instinct_theme: Highest splenic intuition in the now.
gates.notes: 57 hears/feels danger before it arrives. With 20 → pure intuitive expression. Distortion → chronic anxiety / jumpiness.

gates.name: 44 — Coming to Meet (Alertness)
gates.instinct_theme: Instinct for patterns, smells, and people from the past.
gates.notes: 44 remembers who can be trusted. With 26 it can sell or transmit what matters. Distortion → suspicion of everyone.

gates.name: 50 — The Cauldron (Values)
gates.instinct_theme: Protecting the tribe through correct values and care.
gates.notes: 50 says what is ‘right’ to uphold. With 27 it nourishes. Distortion → taking on everyone’s problems.

gates.name: 32 — Duration (Continuity)
gates.instinct_theme: Instinct to sense what can endure or transform.
gates.notes: 32 tests ambition from 54: is this worth backing? Distortion → staying loyal to dead things.

gates.name: 28 — Preponderance of the Great (Struggle for Purpose)
gates.instinct_theme: Survival through finding something worth the struggle.
gates.notes: 28 makes life a meaningful contest. With 38 it fights for purpose. Distortion → courting danger just to feel alive.

gates.name: 18 — Work on What Has Been Spoiled (Correction)
gates.instinct_theme: Instinct to correct what is unhealthy or corrupted.
gates.notes: 18 sees what’s off. With 58 it has joy to do the work. Distortion → chronic criticism of self/others.

notes:
The Spleen is the **oldest** awareness — body-based, in-the-now, and totally ephemeral. If you miss the splenic whisper, it’s gone. It is about **survival, health, immune integrity, and timing**.

Key Jovian-style lines (< 25 words):
- “Splenic awareness is only in the now.”
- “Its fears keep you alive.”
- “It knows what is healthy.”
- “It will not repeat itself.”

Defined Spleen → consistent access to instinct and a built-in sense of what is healthy. Undefined / open Spleen → amplifies others’ fears and gets attached to what isn’t healthy (people, jobs, environments) because it’s afraid to let go.
